column4: I need help getting rid of a search applet on my desktop. There doesnt seem to be any way to remove it and its there every time i log in.
what applet and how did you install it?
i didnt install it that i know of
i think it might be a gnome built in search applet or something
usually you can right click on those and remove them
right click does nothing visible
it stays on top of other windows, and is only on my first desktop
can you get the app to do anything at all that shows what it is? If not, try making a screenshot and I think you can send that to a pastebin
i can type in the search field, and there is a small white triangle that looks like it should be a drop down menu but i think its broken.
where should i post the screen shot?
can i post screenshots on pastebin?!
way cool!
http://imagebin.org/53347

I have no idea, but I had a thought. Right click on your top panel and add the force quit applet. Then do ps -ef > 1.out then kill the search thing, then do ps -ef >2.out and compare the two files until you find what's different and what is the app that you killed. Not a sure thing, and definitely tedious, but I can't think of a faster way off the top of my head
ps -ef > 1.out doesnt display anything
right, that sends it straight to the file named 1.out
how do i kill the process
use the force-quit applet, it gives you a gui way to click on it and kill it
so the force quit conformation, it popped up *under* the app >.<
lol ok killed it thank you for your gelp
sure. Hopefully, you'll be able to tell from the ps outputs
